TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Instrumentation extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Base class for implementing application instrumentation code.

remarks.para: Base class for implementing application instrumentation code. When running with instrumentation turned on, this class will be instantiated for you before any of the application code, allowing you to monitor all of the interaction the system has with the application. An Instrumentation implementation is described to the system through an AndroidManifest.xml's <instrumentation> tag.

Docs.summary: A constructor used when creating managed representations of JNI objects; called by the runtime.

remarks.para: This constructor is invoked by the runtime infrastructure () to create a new managed representation for a Java Native Interface object.
The constructor will initializes the property of the new instance using and .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void AddMonitor (Android.App.Instrumentation.ActivityMonitor monitor);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddMonitor(class Android.App.Instrumentation/ActivityMonitor monitor) cil managed

Docs.summary: Add a new that will be checked whenever an activity is started.

remarks.para: Add a new that will be checked whenever an activity is started. The monitor is added after any existing ones; the monitor will be hit only if none of the existing monitors can themselves handle the Intent.

A canned result to return if the monitor is hit; can be null.
Controls whether the monitor should block the activity start (returning its canned result) or let the call proceed.

Note: This method will be called immediately after . Often instrumentation tests start their test thread in onCreate(); you need to be careful of races between these. (Well between it and everything else, but let's start here.)

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool CheckMonitorHit (Android.App.Instrumentation.ActivityMonitor monitor, int minHits);

Docs.param: The minimum number of hits required.
Docs.summary: Test whether an existing has been hit.

remarks.para: Test whether an existing has been hit. If the monitor has been hit at least minHits times, then it will be removed from the activity monitor list and true returned. Otherwise it is left as-is and false is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void OnCreate (Android.OS.Bundle arguments);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnCreate(class Android.OS.Bundle arguments) cil managed

Docs.param: Any additional arguments that were supplied when the instrumentation was started.
Docs.summary: Called when the instrumentation is starting, before any application code has been loaded.

remarks.para: Called when the instrumentation is starting, before any application code has been loaded. Usually this will be implemented to simply call to begin the instrumentation thread, which will then continue execution in .

If you do not need your own thread -- that is you are writing your instrumentation to be completely asynchronous (returning to the event loop so that the application can run), you can simply begin your instrumentation here, for example call to begin the appropriate first activity of the application.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void OnDestroy ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnDestroy() cil managed

Docs.summary: Called when the instrumented application is stopping, after all of the normal application cleanup has occurred.

remarks.para: Called when the instrumented application is stopping, after all of the normal application cleanup has occurred.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool OnException (Java.Lang.Object obj, Java.Lang.Throwable e);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool OnException(class Java.Lang.Object obj, class Java.Lang.Throwable e) cil managed

Docs.param: The client object that generated the exception. May be an Application, Activity, BroadcastReceiver, Service, or null.
Docs.summary: This is called whenever the system captures an unhandled exception that was thrown by the application.

remarks.para: This is called whenever the system captures an unhandled exception that was thrown by the application. The default implementation simply returns false, allowing normal system handling of the exception to take place.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void OnStart ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnStart() cil managed

Docs.summary: Method where the instrumentation thread enters execution.

remarks.para: Method where the instrumentation thread enters execution. This allows you to run your instrumentation code in a separate thread than the application, so that it can perform blocking operation such as or .
You will typically want to call finish() when this function is done, to end your instrumentation.

MemberSignature.Value: public const string ReportKeyIdentifier;
.field public static literal string ReportKeyIdentifier

Docs.summary: If included in the status or final bundle sent to an IInstrumentationWatcher, this key identifies the class that is writing the report.

remarks.para: If included in the status or final bundle sent to an IInstrumentationWatcher, this key identifies the class that is writing the report. This can be used to provide more structured logging or reporting capabilities in the IInstrumentationWatcher.

MemberSignature.Value: public const string ReportKeyStreamresult;
.field public static literal string ReportKeyStreamresult

Docs.summary: If included in the status or final bundle sent to an IInstrumentationWatcher, this key identifies a string which can simply be printed to the output stream.

remarks.para: If included in the status or final bundle sent to an IInstrumentationWatcher, this key identifies a string which can simply be printed to the output stream. Using these streams provides a "pretty printer" version of the status & final packets. Any bundles including this key should also include the complete set of raw key/value pairs, so that the instrumentation can also be launched, and results collected, by an automated system.

remarks.para: Execute a call on the application's main thread, blocking until it is complete. Useful for doing things that are not thread-safe, such as looking at or modifying the view hierarchy.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SendKeySync (Android.Views.KeyEvent e);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SendKeySync(class Android.Views.KeyEvent e) cil managed

Docs.param: The event to send to the current focus.
Docs.summary: Send a key event to the currently focused window/view and wait for it to be processed.

remarks.para: Send a key event to the currently focused window/view and wait for it to be processed. Finished at some point after the recipient has returned from its event processing, though it may not have completely finished reacting from the event -- for example, if it needs to update its display as a result, it may still be in the process of doing that.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Start ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Start() cil managed

Docs.summary: Create and start a new thread in which to run instrumentation.

remarks.para: Create and start a new thread in which to run instrumentation. This new thread will call to where you can implement the instrumentation.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.App.Activity StartActivitySync (Android.Content.Intent intent);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.App.Activity StartActivitySync(class Android.Content.Intent intent) cil managed

Docs.param: Description of the activity to start.
Docs.summary: Start a new activity and wait for it to begin running before returning.

remarks.para: Start a new activity and wait for it to begin running before returning. In addition to being synchronous, this method as some semantic differences from the standard call: the activity component is resolved before talking with the activity manager (its class name is specified in the Intent that this method ultimately starts), and it does not allow you to start activities that run in a different process. In addition, if the given Intent resolves to multiple activities, instead of displaying a dialog for the user to select an activity, an exception will be thrown.

The function returns as soon as the activity goes idle following the call to its . Generally this means it has gone through the full initialization including and drawn and displayed its initial window.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override IntPtr ThresholdClass { get; }
.property instance native int ThresholdClass

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.App.UiAutomation UiAutomation { get; }
.property instance class Android.App.UiAutomation UiAutomation

Docs.summary: Gets the instance.

remarks.para: Gets the instance.

Note: The APIs exposed via the returned work across application boundaries while the APIs exposed by the instrumentation do not. For example, will not allow you to inject the event in an app different from the instrumentation target, while will work regardless of the current application.
A typical test case should be using either the or APIs. Using both APIs at the same time is not a mistake by itself but a client has to be aware of the APIs limitations.

Docs.summary: Schedule a callback for when the application's main thread goes idle (has no more events to process).

remarks.para: Schedule a callback for when the application's main thread goes idle (has no more events to process).

MemberSignature.Value: public void WaitForIdle (Action recipient);
.method public hidebysig instance void WaitForIdle(class System.Action recipient) cil managed

Docs.summary: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void WaitForIdleSync ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void WaitForIdleSync() cil managed

Docs.summary: Synchronously wait for the application to be idle.

remarks.para: Synchronously wait for the application to be idle. Can not be called from the main application thread -- use to execute instrumentation in its own thread.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.App.Activity WaitForMonitor (Android.App.Instrumentation.ActivityMonitor monitor);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.App.Activity WaitForMonitor(class Android.App.Instrumentation/ActivityMonitor monitor) cil managed

Docs.summary: Wait for an existing to be hit.

remarks.para: Wait for an existing to be hit. Once the monitor has been hit, it is removed from the activity monitor list and the first created Activity object that matched it is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.App.Activity WaitForMonitorWithTimeout (Android.App.Instrumentation.ActivityMonitor monitor, long timeOut);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.App.Activity WaitForMonitorWithTimeout(class Android.App.Instrumentation/ActivityMonitor monitor, int64 timeOut) cil managed

Docs.summary: Wait for an existing to be hit till the timeout expires.

remarks.para: Wait for an existing to be hit till the timeout expires. Once the monitor has been hit, it is removed from the activity monitor list and the first created Activity object that matched it is returned. If the timeout expires, a null object is returned.
